{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3371814,"name":"Eric1","username":"Eric1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eric1/{size}/192260_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-24T01:40:44.974Z","cooked":"

Hey, my team is 100% NEO and in the 2025 season we want to move to krakens, our first project is converting our mk4i swerve from neos to krakens and arenâ€™t sure what parts we need.

This is the falconâ€™s mk4i shaft configurations

image794Ã—277 37 KB

I canâ€™t figure out what these parts are.

I figure that the gear is a 14t Steel Spur Gear (20 DP, 8mm SplineXS Bore) but I canâ€™t figure out the rest, help much appreciated.
I am also not sure if any of it comes with the krakens.

Speaking of which, do we need to buy these things too?

image742Ã—714 55.6 KB

You donâ€™t need to buy the power pole adapter boards, theyâ€™re a nice optional add-on. I believe the rest of the parts are spacers.

I would actually recommend against using them. I personally didnâ€™t quite like how they packaged specifically with our swerve modules, with the wires coming out vertically instead of horizontally.

We had success purchasing the 16t upgrade kit to upgrade our mk4iâ€™s from neos to krakens. It did not come with the necessary spacers but we made up for that by purchasing the 1/8inch 8mm shaft spacer from either WCP or REV. You will not need the powerpole boards although they are a nice quality of life feature if you are using powerpoles and molex SL.

SDS has a kraken conversion kit you can just buy. Thatâ€™s what we did for the same conversion and it worked really well.

Can you send me the link?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-04-24T01:48:18.044Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":156,"readers_count":155,"score":51.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":464288,"topic_slug":"converting-mk4i-w-neos-to-krakens","display_username":"Eric1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":50815,"username":"Rezq","name":"Reza","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rezq/{size}/178141_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58672,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/converting-mk4i-w-neos-to-krakens/464288/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3371827,"name":"Abu","username":"a-star_algorithm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/a-star_algorithm/{size}/222022_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-24T01:51:49.880Z","cooked":"

At the end of the day, it varies from team to team. The adapter boards have a 4-pin MolexSL connector to provide power and CAN to the CANcoders (assuming youâ€™re using them), which simplifies wiring. I would suggest using them, if it does work out with their swerve packaging.

Swerve Drive Specialties

Kit, Pinion Gear (MK4i)

Check this spreadsheet for current lead times. This kit contains the components specific to the type of motor used with the MK4i Swerve Module. Example: Selecting the NEO option will enable you to convert a MK4i swerve module originally...

Price: USD 13.00

Looks like you will need to buy the kraken 14t pinions on their own from WCP (WCP-1013)
